warnWhenUnsavedChanges: Are you sure you want to leave? You have unsaved changes.

notifications.createError: There was an error creating {{resource}} (status code: {{statusCode}})

generic.title: Printing
generic.description: Tune in the settings below to get the desired print layout. Keep in mind that printers and your OS may apply it's own margins and scaling, so you may need to perform some trial-and-error before it's all correct. Test it on a piece of regular paper before printing on the actual labels.
generic.helpMargin: Margins should be configured to match your label paper and printer, changing these will affect the size of the entire grid.
generic.helpPrinterMargin: Safe-Zone should be set to how close to the paper edge your printer can print, changing these will not affect the entire grid.
generic.deleteSettingsConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this preset?
generic.exportDpiHelp: Higher DPI improves image quality for exports but increases file size.

qrcode.title: Label Printing
qrcode.templateHelp: Use {} to insert values of the spool object as text. For example, {id} will be replaced with the spool id, or {filament.material} will be replaced with the material of the spool. if a value is missing it will be replaced with "?". A second set of {} can be used to remove this. In addition, any text between the sets of {} will be removed if the value is missing. For example, {Lot Nr: {lot_nr}} will only show the label if the spool has a lot number. Enclose text with double asterix ** to make it bold, and use ==text== to invert text. Click the button to view a list of all available tags.
qrcode.templateHelpFilament: Use {} to insert values of the filament object as text. For example, {id} will be replaced with the filament id, or {vendor.name} will be replaced with the vendor name. If a value is missing it will be replaced with "?". A second set of {} can be used to remove this. In addition, any text between the sets of {} will be removed if the value is missing. For example, {Article: {article_number}} will only show the label if a filament has an article number. Enclose text with double asterix ** to make it bold, and use ==text== to invert text. Click the button to view a list of all available tags.

useHTTPUrl.label: QR code link
useHTTPUrl.tooltip: Will use proprietary link that will work only if scanned from Spoolman's scanning feature (default). URL uses either the base URL specified in settings, or the current page URL if not set.

qrcode.filenameTemplateTooltipSpool: Use {} to insert values of the spool object as text. Refer to the label template rules and available tags for details.
qrcode.filenameTemplateTooltipFilament: Use {} to insert values of the filament object as text. Refer to the label template rules and available tags for details.
qrcode.titleTemplateTooltipSpool: Use {} to insert values of the spool object as text. Refer to the label template rules and available tags for details.
qrcode.titleTemplateTooltipFilament: Use {} to insert values of the filament object as text. Refer to the label template rules and available tags for details.

spoolSelect.title: Select Spools
spoolSelect.description: Select spools to print labels for.
spoolSelect.noSpoolsSelected: You have not selected any spools.

filamentSelect.title: Select Filaments
filamentSelect.description: Select filaments to print labels for.
filamentSelect.noFilamentsSelected: You have not selected any filaments.

scanner.title: QR Code Scanner
scanner.description: Scan a Spoolman QR code to view details about the spool.

error.notAllowed: You have not allowed access to the camera.
error.insecureContext: The page is not served over HTTPS.
error.streamApiNotSupported: The browser does not support the MediaStream API.

fields_help.price: Price of a full spool. If not set, the price of the filament will be assumed instead.
fields_help.weight_to_use: Select what weight value to enter. Measured weight is only available if the spool weight is set for the selected filament.
fields_help.used_weight: How much filament has been used from the spool. A new spool should have 0g used.
fields_help.remaining_weight: How much filament is left on the spool. For a new spool this should match the spool weight.
fields_help.measured_weight: How much the filament and spool weigh.
fields_help.initial_weight: The initial weight of filament on the spool (net weight). Will use the weight from the filament object if not set.
fields_help.spool_weight: The weight of the spool when it is empty. Leave empty to use the value from the filament or the manufacturer.
fields_help.location: Where the spool is located if you have multiple locations where you store your spools.
fields_help.lot_nr: Manufacturer's lot number. Can be used to ensure a print has consistent color if multiple spools are used.
fields_help.external_filament: You have selected a filament from the external database. A filament object (and possibly a manufacturer object) will be created automatically when you create this spool. This can create duplicate filament objects if you have already created a filament object for this filament.

form.adjust_filament_help: Here you can directly add or subtract filament from the spool. A positive value will consume filament, a negative value will add it.
form.spool_updated: This spool has been updated by someone/something else since you opened this page. Saving will overwrite those changes!

messages.archive: Are you sure you want to archive this spool?

fields_help.name: Filament name, to distinguish this filament type among others from the same manufacturer. Should contain the color for example.
fields_help.weight: The filament weight of a full spool (net weight). This should not include the weight of the spool itself, only the filament. It is what is usually written on the packaging.
fields_help.spool_weight: The weight of an empty spool. Used to determine measured weight of a spool.
fields_help.multi_color_direction: Filaments can have multiple colors in two ways: either through coextrusion, like dual-color filaments with consistent multi-colors, or through longitudinal color changes, like gradient filaments that shift colors along the spool.

form.filament_updated: This filament has been updated by someone/something else since you opened this page. Saving will overwrite those changes!
form.import_external_description:
Select a filament in the list to automatically populate its details in the filament creation form. This will overwrite any data you have entered in the form.

A Manufacturer object will be created automatically when you click Ok, if necessary.

fields_help.empty_spool_weight: The weight of an empty spool from this manufacturer.
fields_help.logo_url: Optional custom logo used in the UI. Supports absolute URLs or local paths like /vendor-logos/web/bambu-lab-web.png.
fields_help.print_logo_url: Optional custom logo used for label rendering. Supports absolute URLs or local paths like /vendor-logos/print/bambu-lab.png.
fields_help.logo_suggestions: Checks the logo database for files with names similar to this manufacturer.
fields_help.print_logo_suggestions: Checks the print-logo database for files with names similar to this manufacturer.

buttons.convert_logo_to_print_help: Creates a black-and-white print logo from the current Logo URL and stores it as a separate local print logo file.

form.vendor_updated: This manufacturer has been updated by someone/something else since you opened this page. Saving will overwrite those changes!
form.logo_sync_no_match: No matching logos found for this manufacturer name.
form.logo_preview_auto_notice: using auto-matched logo from bundled logo pack
form.logo_preview_default_notice: no logo defined, using default generated text logo
form.logo_convert_success: Generated print logo from web logo.
form.logo_convert_error: Could not generate a print logo from this Logo URL.

home.description: It looks like you haven't added any spools yet. See the <helpPageLink>Help page</helpPageLink> for help getting started.

resources.filament: Brands of filament. They have properties such as name, material, color, diameter, and more.
resources.spool: Individual physical spools of a specific filament.
resources.vendor: The companies that make the filament.

help.description:
Here are some tips to get you started.

Spoolman holds 3 different types of data:

To add a new spool to the database, start by creating a Filament object. Once that's done, proceed to create a Spool object for that specific spool. If you acquire additional spools of the same filament later on, simply generate additional Spool objects and reuse the same Filament object.

Optionally, you can also generate a Manufacturer object for the company manufacturing the filament if you wish to track that information.

You have the option to link other 3D printer services to Spoolman, like Moonraker, which can automatically monitor filament usage and update the Spool objects for you. Refer to the Spoolman README for guidance on how to set that up.

base_url.label: Base URL
base_url.tooltip: The base URL to use when generating features such as QR codes.

round_prices.label: Round prices
round_prices.tooltip: Round prices to the nearest whole number.

logo_sync.title: Global Manufacturer Logo Sync
logo_sync.description: Syncs missing logo URLs across the whole manufacturer database using the bundled logo manifest. Existing logo URLs are not overwritten.
logo_sync.where: Source: /vendor-logos/manifest.json (bundled static web/print logo files). Matching ignores minor punctuation/case differences in names.
logo_sync.not_ready: Logo manifest is not available yet.
logo_sync.load_error: Could not load manufacturers for logo sync.
logo_sync.github_description: Checks the upstream logo repository for changes and downloads files only when there is a newer logo pack. No re-download happens when unchanged.
logo_sync.github_load_error: Could not check GitHub logo updates.
logo_sync.github_done_updated: Logo pack updated from GitHub. Web: {{web}}, Print: {{print}}.
logo_sync.github_done_no_changes: Logo pack already up to date. Web: {{web}}, Print: {{print}}.
logo_sync.scope_note: This action syncs the whole manufacturer database. You can sync a single manufacturer from its Edit page.

extra_fields.description:
Here you can add extra custom fields to your entities.

Once a field is added, you can not change its key or type, and for choice type fields you can not remove choices or change the multi choice state. If you remove a field, the associated data for all entities will be deleted.

The key is what other programs read/write the data as, so if your custom field is supposed to integrate with a third-party program, make sure to set it correctly. Default value is only applied to new items.

Extra fields can not be sorted or filtered in the table views.
extra_fields.choices_missing_error: You cannot remove choices. The following choices are missing: {{choices}}
extra_fields.key_not_changed: Please change the key to something else.
extra_fields.delete_confirm_description: This will delete the field and all associated data for all entities.

locations.no_locations_help: This page lets you organize your spools in locations, add some spools to get started!
